alert.note: Alert for Eastern Essex; Eastern Hanover; Eastern King William; Eastern King and Queen; New Kent; Western Essex; Western King William; Western King and Queen (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 04 at 3:23PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...An area of strong thunderstorms will impact portions of central King and Queen, northwestern New Kent, central King William and south central Essex Counties through 430 PM EDT... At 322 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over King William. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and locally heavy rainfall. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... King William, Saint Stephens Church, King And Queen Court House, Tunstall, Millers Tavern, Stevensville, Manquin, Aylett, Howertons, Central Garage, Dragonville, Walkerton, Rose Garden, Quinton, Rumford, Lanesville, Crouch, Henley Fork, Palls and Bruington. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Essex; Eastern Hanover; Eastern King William; Eastern King and Queen; New Kent; Western Essex; Western King William; Western King and Queen
